narrative=Chloe Hall had recently moved to Rosyth after selling her longtime residence in Truro. Her sudden relocation came as a surprise to her sister, who remained in their hometown. narrative=Chloe Hall, a 91-year-old woman, was last seen in a parking lot near the library in Rosyth. Her sister had been making arrangements to pick her up, but upon arrival, Chloe was nowhere to be found. Earlier, Chloe had been seen entering the library, and security footage confirmed she did not leave through the main exit. Her friend, who often accompanied her on walks, mentioned that Chloe sometimes intended to visit the pharmacy across town. The concern grew when she did not return home that evening. After a police search, Chloe was found safe and sound at a relative's house on David the First Street, having wandered there due to disorientation exacerbated by her disability.
